value.title: Skills needed for a Power BI Developer
value.excerpt: So you want to become a Power BI Developer, and wonder what skills you need to learn, what are the best resources to learn from, and where to start? This is an article and video explaining those in detail and helping you in your journey to become a Power BI Developer. Find all the links in my blog article
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Yau0tVP0H8U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Sort a Column with a Custom Order in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have previously written about how to sort a column by another column, and I used Month Names as an example. However, still, many are unaware that the same technique with slight modifications can be applied to any other columns. You can have a text column in your slicer (product category for example),
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CpBy79AawVw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: What a Power BI Hierarchy Is and How to Use it
value.excerpt: Power BI hierarchies are a useful structure for drill-down and data exploration in reports. A hierarchy can be created simply and can add great value for you as a developer and end-users for better data analysis. In this article and video, Iâ€™ll explain what a Power BI hierarchy is and how to create it.

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
value.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #03: Remove single column filters
value.excerpt: Use REMOVEFILTERS in CALCULATE to clear the filter from a column. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. value.title: Creating indexes in Power BI
value.excerpt: A playlist of videos on how to create index columns in Power BI.

topItems.title: Add index to nested tables in Power Query

value.title: Automate data cleaning with Power Query
value.excerpt: This module introduces Power Query in Microsoft Excel, a powerful data connection, cleaning, and shaping technology that is a core part of the Microsoft modern analytics suite of business intelligence tools.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Add DAX calculation groups to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: Learn how you can add many similar measures to your model.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You'll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you'll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.
